title: #10 Shepherd 48, Glenville State 31
text: Last updated on October 10, 2015 @ 9:34PM Created on October 10, 2015 @ 5:50PM MEC Roundup courtesy Mountaineast.org: *No. 10 Shepherd 48, Glenville State 31 | Final Stats <http://stats.statbroadcast.com/broadcast/?a=1&id=98142>GLENVILLE, W.Va. --* Tenth-ranked Shepherd remained unbeaten and at the top of the MEC standings with a key 48-31 win over Glenville State on Saturday afternoon at Morris Stadium. Shepherd improves to 5-0, 5-0 in conference play, while Glenville State falls to 4-2, 4-2. Junior quarterback Jeff Ziemba completed 17-of-28 passes for 292 yards and three touchdowns and Allen Cross added 108 yards on 20 carries to lead the Rams. Jabre Lolley came out of the backfield and had three catches for 156 yards and two touchdowns. Shepherd was led on defense by James Gupton who had 11 total tackles. Glenville State, playing without Rahmann Lee, was led by Tevin Drake who had 112 yards on 26 carries and one touchdown. Quarterback Sean Steele completed just 23-of-48 yards for 249 yards and two touchdowns. Wes Lane led the Pioneers on defense with 11 sacks and Marcus Umu had 1.5 of GSC's five sacks on the day. *Charleston 42, West Liberty 37 | Final Stats <http://stats.statbroadcast.com/broadcast/?a=1&id=98143>WEST LIBERTY, W.Va. *--The University of Charleston rallied from a nine-point second half deficit and held off a late West Liberty charge on Saturday afternoon to come away with a 42-37 win at West Family Stadium. Charleston (5-1, 5-1) was led by another standout performance from Jeremy Johnson who had 217 yards passing and one touchdown and another 107 yards and one TD on the ground. Tevion Cappe added 71 yards and a TD on the ground. Rhakeen Stallings had nine tackles and an interception for the Golden Eagles on defense. Quarterback Dakota Conwell was 19-of-32 for 399 yards with four touchdowns and two interceptions to lead the West Liberty (3-3, 3-2) offense. Anton McCallum had seven catches for 181 yards and three scores, and Daree' Goodwin had six grabs for 155 yards and a TD. Andrew Fairamo had 15 tackles (13 solo), including two for a loss, for the Hilltoppers on defense. West Liberty had the edge in total offense 515-449, but the Hilltoppers had two turnovers compared to none for the Golden Eagles. *West Virginia State 32, Notre Dame 29 | Final Stats <http://stats.statbroadcast.com/broadcast/?a=1&id=98144>INSTITUTE, W.Va. -- *Matt Kinnick's nine-yard touchdown strike to Tyrone Barber with :55 seconds left in the game lifted West Virginia State to a 32-29 win over Notre Dame on Saturday afternoon at Lakin Field. The Yellow Jackets (4-2, 4-2) rallied from a 22-17 deficit after three quarters. WVSU had a safety and two touchdowns in the final 15 minutes to cap the comeback. Kinnick was 35-of-55 for 370 yards with two touchdowns and two interceptions in the victory. Barber added 102 rushing yards to go with his touchdown reception, and Quinton Gray had 131 receiving yards for WVSU. Mitch Rowell led the Yellow Jackets with 13 total tackles. Malik Grove had 353 yards and three touchdowns through the air and 80 more on the ground for Notre Dame (1-5, 1-4). Mitchell Shegos had a game-high 154 yards receiving and a pair of scores and D.J. Green added 91 more on the ground. Zach Chatlain had 12 tackles with a TFL and one interception. *Concord 63, UVa-Wise 21 | Final Stats <http://stats.statbroadcast.com / broadcast/?id=96870>ATHENS, W.Va.* -- Calvinaugh Jones rushed for 262 yards and three touchdowns as Concord posted a 63-21 victory over UVa-Wise at Callaghan Stadium Saturday. The victorious Mountain Lions held the Cavaliers to -9 rushing yards as they built a 56-7 lead after three quarters. The Mountain Lions (4-2, 4-2) had 556 yards of total offense, including 327 on the ground, and held UVa-Wise (0-6, 0-5) to just 235 yards on the day. Quarterback Brian Novak was an efficient 15-of-23 for 221 and two touchdowns to help balance the CU attack. Ervin Moore harassed the Cavs and posted six tackles, including three for a loss and a pair of sacks. Jeremy Eubank had 244 yards passing and a touchdown, and Terrance Younger finished with six catches for 161 yards. Zachary Blair tallied 12 tackles, five for loss in defeat. *Urbana 33, Lake Erie 30 | Final Stats <http://stats.statbroadcast.com/broadcast/?a=1&id=98141>* *PAINESVILLE, Ohio â€“ *Urbana tallied 33-30 come-from-behind 33-30 win on over Lake Erie on Saturday afternoon at Jack Britt Memorial Stadium. Urbana improves to 2-4 on the year. Senior Deonta Rudasill rushed for a career-high 110 yards on 15 carries and senior Cedric Presley scored three times, twice on the ground and once through the air, totaling 91 all-purpose yards to lead the way. Two of Presley's touchdowns came in the fourth quarter. Making his third career start, junior quarterback Eric Pelfrey was 14-of-21 with no turnovers. He also recorded his first multi-touchdown performance with two TD strikes through the air. Urbana totaled 424 yards and did not turn the ball over for the first time in 2015. The Blue Knights were also efficient on third downs, going 6-for-11 (55.0%). D'Gary Wallace recorded 19 total tackles and fellow linebacker Kevin Chapple finished with 10 stops. Isaiah Turner had an outstanding game in the trenches, leading the Blue Knights with four tackles for loss (eight total tackles).
